content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #78113 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
I'm not sure if we consider this a "regression" or not given that this is a nightly feature, but I wanted to check that this is an intended change.
I don't think we care about nightly features
So this is an expected change from compile pass to compile fail?
i think this is a bug and we should accept this code
but wg-prioritization does not need to - or even should imo - prioritize bugs issues which can not affect users which don't use any unstable features afaik
Yes, I agree. I just wanted a way to check if this is an intended change.
most likely will be fixed as a side effect of something else being implemented

Camelid said:

I'm not sure if we consider this a "regression" or not given that this is a nightly feature, but I wanted to check that this is an intended change.

Basically if it needs a nightly compiler (nightly feature, -Z flags, etc...), we can't consider it a regression-from-stable-to-* because it hasn't reached stable yet.
